title: 110_s1350
content: IMMIGRANTS WITH ADVANCED DEGREES. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include immigrants with advanced degrees in the worldwide level of diversity immigrants. The allocation of immigrant visas is adjusted to accommodate 18,333 diversity immigrants and 36,667 immigrants with advanced degrees annually. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include immigrants with advanced degrees in science, mathematics, technology, or engineering. Qualified immigrants with master's or doctorate degrees in these fields will be allotted visas each fiscal year. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include immigrants with advanced degrees in science, mathematics, technology, or engineering. Visas will be allotted each fiscal year not exceeding the worldwide level specified. The Secretary of State, in consultation with other departments, will determine which degrees are most needed to meet workforce needs and protect the economic security of the United States. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include immigrants with advanced degrees in specific fields. The Secretary of State will maintain information on the characteristics of immigrants issued visas under different paragraphs. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include immigrants with advanced degrees in specific fields. Immigrant visas under subsection (c)(2) will be issued in a random order if the Secretary of State has not made a determination, or based on a specified worldwide level if a determination has been made. The Secretary will issue immigrant visas in a random order if the worldwide level specified in section 201(e)(2) is exceeded. If the number of eligible immigrants with degrees is within the specified level, visas will be issued to them first before others. The Secretary will issue immigrant visas in a random order to eligible immigrants with degrees as specified, effective October 1, 2007. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow for the carryover of advanced degree visas and diversity visas from fiscal year 2007 onwards, even if the application was made in a different fiscal year.
